poem:
### Generation Z

In the dawning light,
the old with crumbling hands
feast on the fresh bloom
of youth, blank eyes flicker.
Society splintered,
by gnawing desperation,
a grotesque communion.
History's tale, devoured
in bloody repetition,
newborn hearts,
insatiable ghosts,
lingering.
